semantic_title: Present on Admission (POA) Indicator Assignment for External Cause of Injury Codes
section_path: Present on Admission Reporting Guidelines > External Cause of Injury Codes

content.full_text: Assign 'Y' for any external cause code representing an external cause of morbidity that occurred prior to inpatient admission (e.g., patient fell out of bed at home, patient fell out of bed in emergency room prior to admission) Assign 'N' for any external cause code representing an external cause of morbidity that occurred during inpatient hospitalization (e.g., patient fell out of hospital bed during hospital stay, patient experienced an adverse reaction to a medication administered after inpatient admission). (Evidence: pg no: 121, L26-L27)
content.summary: Guidelines for assigning POA indicators to external cause codes based on timing of the external cause event relative to admission (Evidence: pg no: 121, L26-L27)
key_concepts: External cause timing relative to admission (Evidence: pg no: 121, L27)
Pre-admission external causes (Evidence: pg no: 121, L27)
Post-admission external causes (Evidence: pg no: 121, L27)
Hospital-acquired external causes (Evidence: pg no: 121, L27)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Assign 'Y' for any external cause code representing an external cause of morbidity that occurred prior to inpatient admission (Evidence: pg no: 121, L27)
detailed_rules.explanation: External cause codes receive POA indicator 'Y' when the external cause event happened before the patient was admitted to inpatient status (Evidence: pg no: 121, L27)
common_applications: Emergency room incidents prior to admission

detailed_rules.rule_text: Assign 'N' for any external cause code representing an external cause of morbidity that occurred during inpatient hospitalization (Evidence: pg no: 121, L27)
detailed_rules.explanation: External cause codes receive POA indicator 'N' when the external cause event happened after inpatient admission (Evidence: pg no: 121, L27)

workflow_steps: Step 2: Determine timing of external cause event
Step 3: Compare timing to inpatient admission
Step 4: Assign 'Y' if external cause occurred before admission
Step 5: Assign 'N' if external cause occurred during hospitalization

warnings: Focus on timing of external cause event, not location (Evidence: pg no: 121, L27)
Hospital location does not automatically mean POA 'N' if before admission (Evidence: pg no: 121, L27)
best_practices: Clearly document timing of external cause events (Evidence: pg no: 121, L27)
Distinguish between pre-admission and post-admission events (Evidence: pg no: 121, L27)
common_mistakes: Confusing hospital location with inpatient admission timing (Evidence: pg no: 121, L27)
Not recognizing post-admission medication effects as hospital-acquired (Evidence: pg no: 121, L27)
tips: Compare external cause timing to inpatient admission time (Evidence: pg no: 121, L27)
